intro: Oncosporum bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its distinctive two-toned leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers are small and clustered, forming panicles that are often tinged with green or brown. Oncosporum bicolor plays a role in supporting local wildlife and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
